verses.text: 星象家朝拜耶穌希律王執政的時候，耶穌生在猶太的伯利恆。那時，有幾個星象家（「星象家」或譯：「智者」）從東方來到耶路撒冷，

words.note: Lit. 'star phenomenon specialist'.
Originally 'pay respects at court'.
Lit. 'star phenomenon specialist'.

verses.text: 說：「那生下來作猶太人的王的在哪裡？我們看見他的星出現，特來朝拜他。」

words.note: Here nominalizes the preceding phrase into 'the one who is...'.
Originally 'pay respects at court'.

verses.text: 希律王聽見了就心裡不安，全耶路撒冷的居民也是這樣。
他就召集所有的祭司長和民間的經學家，問他們基督應該生在哪裡。

words.note: Lit. 'scripture study specialist'.

verses.text: 他們回答：「在猶太的伯利恆。因為有先知在經上這樣說：

words.note: Lit. 'first to know'.

verses.text: 『猶大地的伯利恆啊！你在猶大的領袖中，並不是最小的，因為必有一位領袖從你那裡出來，牧養我的子民以色列。』」

words.note: Expresses exclamation or surprise.
Historically, 'collar and sleeve' referred to leaders.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'amongst' or 'within'.
Intensifies the negation '不是'.
Commonly used in religious contexts for spiritual care.
Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 希律暗中把星象家召來，仔細查問他們，那顆星甚麼時候出現，

words.note: Indicates that the following noun is the object of the verb.
Refers to ancient scholars who studied stars.

verses.text: 然後派他們到伯利恆去，說：「你們去細心尋訪那小孩，找到了就向我報告，好叫我也去拜他。」

words.note: More formal than just '找' (zhǎo).
Indicates successful completion of an action.
Functions as a purpose conjunction, similar to '以便'.

verses.text: 他們聽命去了。他們在東方看見的那顆星，忽然在他們前頭，領他們到那小孩所在的地方，就在上頭停住了。

words.note: Formal or respectful way to say 'obey'.
A verb-complement structure indicating perception.
Indicates the place where something or someone is.

verses.text: 他們看見那顆星，歡喜極了；

words.note: A verb-complement structure indicating perception.
Used to express an extreme degree of an adjective or verb.

verses.text: 進了房子，看見小孩和他母親馬利亞，就俯伏拜他，並且打開寶盒，把黃金、乳香、沒藥作禮物獻給他。

words.note: To lie face down in reverence or submission.
Often means 'worship' in religious context.
Indicates direct object is placed before verb.
Aromatic resin, milky when fresh.
Aromatic gum resin, used for incense and embalming.

verses.text: 後來他們在夢中得著指示不要回到希律那裡去，就從別的路回鄉去了。
逃往埃及他們走了以後，主的使者在夢中向約瑟顯現，說：「起來，帶著孩子和他母親逃到埃及去，留在那裡，直到我再指示你，因為希律要尋找這孩子，把他殺掉。」

words.note: Often translated as 'angel' in religious texts.
Indicates direct object is placed before verb.

verses.text: 約瑟就起來，連夜帶著孩子和他母親往埃及去，

words.note: Implies immediately, through the night.

verses.text: 住在那裡，直到希律死了，為的是要應驗主藉先知所說的：「我從埃及召我的兒子出來。」

words.note: Literary/formal equivalent of 透過 (tòuguò).
Forms nominal phrase with verb, e.g., 'what was said'.
Often means 'summon' or 'call' in a formal/divine sense.

verses.text: 屠殺嬰孩希律見自己被星象家愚弄了，就大怒，於是照著他從星象家所問得的日子，下令把伯利恆和附近地方，兩歲以下的小孩全都殺死。

words.note: Refers to the Magi or 'wise men' from the East.
Refers to the Magi or 'wise men' from the East.
Forms a noun phrase 'what was inquired'.

verses.text: 這就應驗了耶利米先知所說的：

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'what was said'.

verses.text: 「在拉瑪聽見有聲音，是痛哭、極大哀號的聲音；拉結為她的兒女哀哭，不肯受安慰，因為他們都不在了。」

words.note: Here implies 'no longer exist' or 'are gone'.

verses.text: 從埃及回來希律死後，在埃及，主的使者在夢中向約瑟顯現，
說：「那些要殺害這孩子的人已經死了。起來，帶著孩子和他母親回以色列地去吧。」
約瑟就起來，帶著小孩子和他母親回到以色列地。

words.note: Indicates ongoing action

verses.text: 只是聽見亞基老接續他父親希律作了猶太王，他就不敢到猶太地去；又在夢中得了指示，於是往加利利境去，
來到拿撒勒城住下，這樣就應驗了先知所說的：「他必稱為拿撒勒人。」

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for prophecy fulfillment.
Lit. 'fore-knower'.
Forms a nominal phrase with a following verb.
Here nominalizes 'what was said by the prophet'.
